intro: Sarcochilus pusillus, commonly known as the dwarf rock orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its small, compact growth habit and produces delicate, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in coastal or mountainous regions. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to retain moisture in arid environments. Sarcochilus pusillus is a rare and endangered species, with limited populations found in specific locations across New Zealand.
